message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.GR, cs.HC 

The paper deals with the problem of automatic marker labelling in optical motion capture, which involves computer vision and machine learning techniques. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a differentiable permutation learning model, which falls under the scope of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The problem of marker labelling can also be viewed as a robotics problem, which makes cs.RO (Robotics) a likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses applications such as motion and behavioural analysis, animation, and biomechanics, which are related to graphics and visualization, making cs.GR (Computer Graphics) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper addresses the issue of labour-intensive post-processing, which is a human-computer interaction problem, making cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) a potential sub-category.
